title: "Choosing the Right Tractor Size for Your Farm: The Ultimate Guide"

tasks.task: Choosing the right tractor size for a farm.
subtasks: Considering the size of the farm (acres).
Evaluating the terrain (flat, rolling hills, steep, rough).
Assessing crop type and required equipment (e.g., plows, planters, harvesters).
Determining the type of tasks to be performed (mowing, tilling, planting, heavy lifting).
Considering future expansion and crop rotation changes.
Researching and consulting with other farmers, equipment dealers, and agricultural extension agents.

tasks.task: Comparing tractor options based on above factors.
subtasks: Evaluating compact and utility tractors for smaller farms (10-50 acres).
Selecting larger tractors (over 80 horsepower) for big acreage (hundreds of acres) or heavy-duty work.
Checking compatibility of chosen tractor with intended tasks and implements.

tasks.task: Planning for the future flexibility of the tractor choice.
subtasks: Slightly overestimating current needs to accommodate potential farm expansion.
Allocating funds for a main tractor (for major fieldwork) and a smaller one (for incidental tasks).
Assessing power balance (not underpowered, not overpriced).
Considering long-term cost-effectiveness (productivity, fuel economy, maintenance).
Confirming the tractor meets specific operational requirements.

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Choosing the right tractor size for a successful farm.
